{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3658608,"name":"","username":"HEFZZJM","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/h/4491bb/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-06-20T10:03:39.901Z","cooked":"

Our team is preparing for the offseason and we decided to learn from some of the best robots this year and build a new robot based on that.
During this process, we noticed that in many robots where the arm is mounted on the elevator (like 4414, 1678), teams often choose to build a custom gearbox for the arm joint instead of using a COTS solution like the MAXPlanetary.
Is there a deeper reason why custom gearboxes are so common in these designs?
I understand that the arm usually needs to be fixed to a large sprocket or timing pulley, and that integrating that with a shaft or output plate is often easier with a custom gearbox. But beyond that ‚Äî for the rest of the reduction ‚Äî is there a strong reason why teams don‚Äôt just use COTS gear stages upstream and only customize the final stage?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-06-20T10:03:39.901Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":18,"reads":624,"readers_count":623,"score":314.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":503418,"topic_slug":"why-do-most-arm-on-elevator-designs-use-custom-gearboxes-for-the-arm-is-there-a-deeper-reason-for-this","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53545,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Code Mentor 6940"},"post_url":"/t/why-do-most-arm-on-elevator-designs-use-custom-gearboxes-for-the-arm-is-there-a-deeper-reason-for-this/503418/1","custom_user_title":"Code Mentor 6940","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3658609,"name":"Patrick","username":"Patrick3357","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-20T10:47:46.565Z","cooked":"

Basically packaging I think. We only had enough room for a motor with a pinion, both the motor and the pinion had about 1/4‚Äù of clearance to elevator stages or the arm. Also worth noting that many of the big name, hyper competitive teams use many fewer COTS components in general because they have the design and fabrication resources to routinely make fully custom mechanisms. The performance or weight advantages of going custom could be pretty small.

For completeness: The large sprocket or pulley with a large reduction is very important to handle the torque. COTS gearboxes and hex shafts can not handle the torque.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-06-21T02:21:38.194Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":601,"readers_count":600,"score":355.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":503418,"topic_slug":"why-do-most-arm-on-elevator-designs-use-custom-gearboxes-for-the-arm-is-there-a-deeper-reason-for-this","display_username":"Patrick","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":15}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52597,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Build mentor"},"post_url":"/t/why-do-most-arm-on-elevator-designs-use-custom-gearboxes-for-the-arm-is-there-a-deeper-reason-for-this/503418/2","custom_user_title":"Build mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":15}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":15,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658610,"name":"","username":"Alex_Y","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-06-20T10:49:04.752Z","cooked":"

Maxplanetaries do not have the best backlash ever, and arms are extremely sensitive to even small amounts of backlash. Maxplanetaries also force you to use a hex shaft as the final output, which are often not strong or stiff enough for many arms. Custom gearboxes can allow for the final chain reduction to be screwed directly into one of the output gears, which improves strength and stiffness.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-06-20T10:49:04.752Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":567,"readers_count":566,"score":598.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":503418,"topic_slug":"why-do-most-arm-on-elevator-designs-use-custom-gearboxes-for-the-arm-is-there-a-deeper-reason-for-this","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":32}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50219,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/why-do-most-arm-on-elevator-designs-use-custom-gearboxes-for-the-arm-is-there-a-deeper-reason-for-this/503418/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":24},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":8}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":32,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658611,"name":"Peter Matteson","username":"Peter_Matteson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_matteson/{size}/136196_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-20T10:57:16.967Z","cooked":"

These 2 nailed it. Packaging and gearbox lash are the 2 biggest issues that drive a custom gearbox for an arm.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-06-20T10:57:31.618Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":525,"readers_count":524,"score":345.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":503418,"topic_slug":"why-do-most-arm-on-elevator-designs-use-custom-gearboxes-for-the-arm-is-there-a-deeper-reason-for-this","display_username":"Peter Matteson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":16}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":2449,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Into my 2nd FRC retirement..."},"post_url":"/t/why-do-most-arm-on-elevator-designs-use-custom-gearboxes-for-the-arm-is-there-a-deeper-reason-for-this/503418/4","custom_user_title":"Into my 2nd FRC retirement...","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":14},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":16,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658612,"name":"","username":"GeraldTM","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geraldtm/{size}/246403_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-20T11:37:43.508Z","cooked":"

Also custom gearboxes are fun to design/look cool

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-06-20T11:37:43.508Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":499,"readers_count":498,"score":324.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":503418,"topic_slug":"why-do-most-arm-on-elevator-designs-use-custom-gearboxes-for-the-arm-is-there-a-deeper-reason-for-this","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":15}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68269,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"üá®üá¶ 9062 Lead Design Mentor üá®üá¶"},"post_url":"/t/why-do-most-arm-on-elevator-designs-use-custom-gearboxes-for-the-arm-is-there-a-deeper-reason-for-this/503418/5","custom_user_title":"üá®üá¶ 9062 Lead Design Mentor üá®üá¶","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":11},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":15,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3659242,"name":"Adam Fleming","username":"AdamF","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adamf/{size}/234717_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-21T14:14:30.826Z","cooked":"
HEFZZJM:

is there a strong reason why teams don‚Äôt just use COTS gear stages upstream and only customize the final stage?

I think the strongest reason is in your question. If you are spending the time to design a custom final stage, then the effort to package the rest of the reductions is likely to be a similar effort to packaging a single final reduction and a COTS gearbox.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-06-21T14:14:30.826Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":388,"readers_count":387,"score":122.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":503418,"topic_slug":"why-do-most-arm-on-elevator-designs-use-custom-gearboxes-for-the-arm-is-there-a-deeper-reason-for-this","display_username":"Adam Fleming","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":41952,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 3596 Lead Mentor/Alum, FTC 30607 Lead Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/why-do-most-arm-on-elevator-designs-use-custom-gearboxes-for-the-arm-is-there-a-deeper-reason-for-this/503418/6","custom_user_title":"FRC 3596 Lead Mentor/Alum, FTC 30607 Lead Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3659280,"name":"Isaac Proctor","username":"Isaac-The-Pro","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/isaac-the-pro/{size}/265401_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-21T16:43:42.914Z","cooked":"

We also used a custom gearbox for our arm, and we used that as opposed to a COTS planetary gearbox for a few reasons: most notably backlash, but also simply because it fit better with our design. With a custom gearbox, the gearbox could be integrated into the pivot plates, and allowed the motors to be closer to the center of the robot, which helped the CoG for our climber. We had a pivoting end effector on lifts last year and we used COTS gearboxes, which worked pretty well, but we had backlash issues, but other than that, whether you use COTS or custom gearboxes mostly comes down to the specifics of the design, and how well each one would integrate with everything else.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-06-21T16:43:42.914Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":339,"readers_count":338,"score":102.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":503418,"topic_slug":"why-do-most-arm-on-elevator-designs-use-custom-gearboxes-for-the-arm-is-there-a-deeper-reason-for-this","display_username":"Isaac Proctor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"Regular","title_is_group":false,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69147,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6352 Scouting/Design Lead"},"post_url":"/t/why-do-most-arm-on-elevator-designs-use-custom-gearboxes-for-the-arm-is-there-a-deeper-reason-for-this/503418/7","custom_user_title":"6352 Scouting/Design Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3659290,"name":"Yair Kornblau","username":"Korny","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/korny/{size}/270694_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-21T16:50:41.162Z","cooked":"

For us the main reason is weight. We can usually design a custom gearbox that weighs around half of a max planetary would.
However, wherever weight is less of a concern (gearboxes that are closer to the bottom of the robot) we use max planetaries. Examples being our 2025 climb and indexer, 2024 arm and climber gearboxes all using maxplanetaries.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-06-21T16:50:41.162Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":320,"readers_count":319,"score":254.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":503418,"topic_slug":"why-do-most-arm-on-elevator-designs-use-custom-gearboxes-for-the-arm-is-there-a-deeper-reason-for-this","display_username":"Yair Kornblau","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":10}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":39034,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1690 Strategy/Mechanical design mentor"},"post_url":"/t/why-do-most-arm-on-elevator-designs-use-custom-gearboxes-for-the-arm-is-there-a-deeper-reason-for-this/503418/8","custom_user_title":"1690 Strategy/Mechanical design mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":9},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":10,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3659361,"name":"Ian Osborn","username":"Sands","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/22d042/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-06-21T19:23:22.559Z","cooked":"

Yes, there is also a package and a flexibility benefit.

It‚Äôs pretty hard to make a custom gearbox that is as space efficient as a max planet. Changing ratios is relatively trivial on a planet as well.

Yes, a weight penalty though.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-06-21T19:23:22.559Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":256,"readers_count":255,"score":66.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":503418,"topic_slug":"why-do-most-arm-on-elevator-designs-use-custom-gearboxes-for-the-arm-is-there-a-deeper-reason-for-this","display_username":"Ian Osborn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":39034,"username":"Korny","name":"Yair Kornblau","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/korny/{size}/270694_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52040,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/why-do-most-arm-on-elevator-designs-use-custom-gearboxes-for-the-arm-is-there-a-deeper-reason-for-this/503418/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3659386,"name":"Annalie ","username":"Anna17","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/5f8ce5/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-06-21T19:51:30.179Z","cooked":"

For my team its the efficiency and weight. The efficiency of a max planetary is really bad at roughly 80 precent when a custom gearbox is around 88 to 95

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-06-21T19:51:30.179Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":236,"readers_count":235,"score":62.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":503418,"topic_slug":"why-do-most-arm-on-elevator-designs-use-custom-gearboxes-for-the-arm-is-there-a-deeper-reason-for-this","display_username":"Annalie ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69513,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2471 designer"},"post_url":"/t/why-do-most-arm-on-elevator-designs-use-custom-gearboxes-for-the-arm-is-there-a-deeper-reason-for-this/503418/10","custom_user_title":"2471 designer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3659610,"name":"Elliot S","username":"ElliotS","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/elliots/{size}/177628_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-22T00:10:10.760Z","cooked":"

We ran a max planetary on our arm on our elevator this year and it worked well for us. From my experience, backlash on a max planetary is much less then a non shimmed gearbox(which we have run in the past). Also in 2024 we also ran a planetary gearbox for our shooter rotation on our elevator. In that case it was a versa planetary because our loads were much smaller.

]

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-06-22T00:11:01.804Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":214,"readers_count":213,"score":102.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":503418,"topic_slug":"why-do-most-arm-on-elevator-designs-use-custom-gearboxes-for-the-arm-is-there-a-deeper-reason-for-this","display_username":"Elliot S","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/2877-ligerbots-2025-cad-reveal/501397","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"2877 LigerBots 2025 CAD Reveal","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50070,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Probably CADing | 2877 LigerBots Alum-Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/why-do-most-arm-on-elevator-designs-use-custom-gearboxes-for-the-arm-is-there-a-deeper-reason-for-this/503418/11","custom_user_title":"Probably CADing | 2877 LigerBots Alum-Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3662207,"name":"Calvin Selin","username":"Calvin-Hobbes17","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calvin-hobbes17/{size}/237325_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-24T03:08:29.412Z","cooked":"
Isaac-The-Pro:

as opposed to a COTS planetary gearbox

pretty sure he meant a gearbox like this
